law.text:
As used in KRS 157.900 to 157.915:
"Environmental education" means an education process dealing with the interrelationships among the natural world and its man-made surroundings; is experience-based; interdisciplinary in its approach; and is a continuous life-long process that provides the citizenry with the basic knowledge and skills necessary to individually and collectively encourage positive actions for achieving and maintaining a sustainable balance between man and the environment.
"Environmental literacy" means having adequate knowledge and understanding of environmental information, concepts and processes.
law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 408, sec. 2, effective July 13, 1990.
